boat.full_description:
Built in Cardif, 1875, Madcap worked as a Bristol Channel Pilot Cutter until after World War I when she was sold and converted for leisure use.

Owned by Commander John Burfield, Birdham Pool, for many years in 1970s and 1980s, he sold the boat when he was in his 80s.

Madcap cruised extensively since 1998, including the west coast of Greenland, via Iceland, from Ireland south to Cornwall, Brittany, the Mediterreran, Almerimar, Morocco, Palma and Alicante, down to the Azores and Lorient and north to the west coast of Scotland.

Sold to the Maritime Musuem, la Rochelle, France,
boat.name: Madcap
boat.short_description: For a long time, the only remaining, original Bristol Pilot Cutter still in commission, originally built in 1875, Madcap has a remarkable history.
